evaluation.comments: It's the most imporant position on the field, and we have a great success rate. If they have the above, they are almost certainly a 78 or higher, and even our rare 'misses' are in the 76-77 range.
evaluation.riskAssessment: If you are willing to accept a higher bust rate to be sure you don't miss anyone, accept players on Short Accuracy, Medium Accuracy or Deep Accuracy as low as a B-
Rely only on the carrying score and you will have a good chance at a solid player in the late rounds (3+)

evaluation.comments: This position eats up a lot of scouting points, so if you don't need a WR, this is a good one to skip and save the points. Note that often, you will not see catching or route running because other scores will be B or higher. That is a sign of a very good player.
evaluation.riskAssessment: I don't see any value in taking a flyer on a WR who doesn't reach the above

attributes.description: All Three Scores Must Be At Least This High

evaluation.comments: Tight ends are one of the toughest to scout, and I am happy to have a decent bust rate and even to keep the false alarm rate to here. For a QB you only need 5 stats to get 80% of his total value, for a TE you need 9. This is the best we can do
evaluation.riskAssessment: In late rounds, keep an eye on tight ends who have a combine score of 6.1 and a run block of C+. About 20% are busts, but I average 1 TE of 72 or better after round 5 per draft

evaluation.comments: The bust rate is higher than we like, but it is the best we could do since we don't have a good way to measure Awareness
evaluation.riskAssessment: Don't - You aren't missing anyone good

attributes.description: Both Scores Must Be At Least This High

evaluation.comments: You'll find 1-2 in any given class, and while they usually go early, I can typically find one every 3rd or 4th year in the second round or later
evaluation.riskAssessment: Lower the Pass Block requirement to C+ and you'll get more hits - but about 2 of every 7 will be busts

attributes.description: Both Scores Must Be At Least This High

evaluation.riskAssessment: You could lower the bench to 30 but there's no real point

evaluation.comments: By far the highest alarm rate in the offense, but we just couldn't live with the alternative of an 11% bust rate
evaluation.riskAssessment: If you make this C+ for one and C for the other, you can cut your false alarm rate in half, but it comes at the cost of an 11% bust rate

attributes.description: Both Scores Must Be At Least This High

evaluation.riskAssessment: You can lower the requirements from B- to C and lower your false alarm rate. However, you do so by increasing your bust rate to 13%

attributes.description: All Three Scores Must Be At Least This High

evaluation.comments: The confidence over there looks good but my gut tells me this is still a problem. The two most important stats for a DT(Finesse Moves and Play Recognition) never pop up because other things which don't matter, like hit power are higher. To have to rely on speed (which is only 6% of their score) is a sign of my desperation. So far it is working, but it doesn't feel right.
evaluation.riskAssessment: If it doesn't pass the above, don't take them. So far I haven't found a single player between 72 and 78, they are either studs or duds

attributes.description: All Three Scores Must Be At Least This High

evaluation.comments: Defensive End is a nightmare to scout. Pursuit and Hit Power, which combined are only 4% of the total value, will almost always pop up as 2 of the 3 revealed scores. So in the best case scenario, we can know 42% of the stats for this position. Not nearly enough to work with, I generally skip this position and fill it via Free Agency or by trading draft picks which I know I won't need
evaluation.riskAssessment: It's already as high risk reward as it gets

evaluation.comments: This position eats up a lot of scouting points, so if you don't need a CB, this is a good one to skip and save the points.
evaluation.riskAssessment: Remove the requirement that one coverage stat must be a B. You'll have more potential solid players, although your bust rate will be relatively high

evaluation.comments: This is a very accurate projection. You can ignore Hit Power, it might seem important, but it isn't. It contributes only 3% of the overall value for a LOLB
evaluation.riskAssessment: You can eliminate the need for another score to be at a B-, but it really doesn't gain you much as we haven't yet found a stud LOLB who failed the above

evaluation.comments: The MLB requires a highly balanced physical skillset accounting for 20% of the total score, the Combine Overall is the best predictor of this
evaluation.riskAssessment: Lower the Combine stat to 6.9 and you'll get some great solid players late, but you will have about 20% bust rate

evaluation.comments: This is a very accurate projection. You can ignore Hit Power, it might seem important, but it isn't. It contributes only 3% of the overall value for a ROLB
evaluation.riskAssessment: You can take a shot with replacing the B+ above with a B-, but that greatly increases your risk with little reward

evaluation.comments: There aren't many of these, as low as 1 per 3-4 draft classes. If you find a stud Free Safety, take them
evaluation.riskAssessment: I wouldn't risk it. In 5 draft classes straight, I never found any FS between 74 - 77. You either get a stud using the above, or you should stay away

attributes.description: Both Scores Must Be At Least This High

evaluation.comment: There aren't many of these, as low as 1 per 3-4 draft classes. If you find a stud Strong Safety, take them
evaluation.riskAssessment: Ignore the zone coverage and only go for the pursuit requirement if you want to reach a bit
